Medicine_tweet_206_p$Medicine_tweet_117_.text:
Finding A: Conclusions/interpretation This nationwide retrospective cohort study found a positive correlation between type 1 diabetes and EV infection.
Finding B: Meta-analysis evaluating aspirin for primary prevention in cardiovascular disease – the double-edged sword: NNT 265 (to prevent CV mortality/nonfatal MI + stroke); NNH 210 (major bleeding). #JAMA #CVD\n
Finding C: In all three cities, the researchers identified new cases of autism in mainstream schools, confirming that there is under-diagnosis of autism in China.
Finding D: Psychotherapy has made progress but is still being utilized by only a small portion of young people being treated with antipsychotics, according to the study.

Medicine_tweet_145_p$Medicine_31_p$Medic.text:
Finding A: The 5-year cumulative primary outcome event rate was not significantly different between the groups (2.77% [95% CI, 2.40%-3.20%] for aspirin vs 2.96% [95% CI, 2.58%-3.40%] for no aspirin; hazard ratio [HR], 0.94 [95% CI, 0.77-1.15]; P = .54).
Finding B: In all three cities, new cases of autism were identified by the study in mainstream schools, reflecting current under-diagnosis.
Finding C: A new study on dog behavior may help us better understand how human personalities affect obesity.
Finding D: Aspirin - another drug that doesn\'t seem to make much difference in heart disease prevention in persons at risk

Medicine_346_r$Medicine_15_r$Medicine_63.text:
Finding A: "Our results underscore the importance of a multidisciplinary approach to the assessment and treatment of children and adolescents with ASD that addresses behavioral, psychological and psychiatric, adaptive, sleep, and medical functioning in order to decrease behavioral crises and the utilization of inpatient psychiatric services," Righi and coauthors write in the study published in the Journal of Autism and Developmental Disorders.
Finding B: An AFM height image recorded 1 hour after SDS injection showed random unevenness on the surface, which indicates random adsorption of SDS molecules on the graphene surface.
Finding C: "However the risk of death due to melanoma in this age group is generally low except among a small proportion of cases whose melanomas were already more than 1 mm thick when diagnosed," Professor Green said.
Finding D: Salt increased the microbe-killing capacity of the immune cells, the team reports; the macrophages exposed to high levels of sodium chloride released significantly more microbicidal molecules than those that grew in a culture medium without salt.
Medicine_346_r$Medicine_15_r$Medicine_63.displayed_text:
Finding A: "Our results underscore the importance of a multidisciplinary approach to the assessment and treatment of children and adolescents with ASD that addresses behavioral, psychological and psychiatric, adaptive, sleep, and medical functioning in order to decrease behavioral crises and the utilization of inpatient psychiatric services," Righi and coauthors write in the study published in the Journal of Autism and Developmental Disorders.
Finding B: An AFM height image recorded 1 hour after SDS injection showed random unevenness on the surface, which indicates random adsorption of SDS molecules on the graphene surface.
Finding C: "However the risk of death due to melanoma in this age group is generally low except among a small proportion of cases whose melanomas were already more than 1 mm thick when diagnosed," Professor Green said.
Finding D: Salt increased the microbe-killing capacity of the immune cells, the team reports; the macrophages exposed to high levels of sodium chloride released significantly more microbicidal molecules than those that grew in a culture medium without salt.

Medicine_44_r$Medicine_tweet_11_p$Medici.text:
Finding A: Distance between ponds and various landscape features could not fully explain the observed genetic differences.
Finding B: Here we show that, although there are sex/gender differences in brain and behavior, humans and human brains are comprised of unique "mosaics" of features, some more common in females compared with males, some more common in males compared with females, and some common in both females and males.
Finding C: Given evidence for more pronounced MSDP-offspring smoking links in daughters (12-14, 16,17,19,24) and for sex differences in prenatal glucocorticoid levels (59) and offspring outcomes after prenatal glucocorticoid exposure (60), we also hypothesized that links between prenatal glucocorticoids and offspring ND would be stronger for daughters.
Finding D: The tetraspanin CD81 contains a large intramembrane cavity occupied by cholesterol, indicating the potential for functional modulation by small molecules.

Finding A: Distance between ponds and various landscape features could not fully explain the observed genetic differences.
Finding B: Here we show that, although there are sex/gender differences in brain and behavior, humans and human brains are comprised of unique "mosaics" of features, some more common in females compared with males, some more common in males compared with females, and some common in both females and males.
Finding C: Given evidence for more pronounced MSDP-offspring smoking links in daughters (12-14, 16,17,19,24) and for sex differences in prenatal glucocorticoid levels (59) and offspring outcomes after prenatal glucocorticoid exposure (60), we also hypothesized that links between prenatal glucocorticoids and offspring ND would be stronger for daughters.
Finding D: The tetraspanin CD81 contains a large intramembrane cavity occupied by cholesterol, indicating the potential for functional modulation by small molecules.

Medicine_tweet_75_p$Medicine_72_r$Medici.text:
Finding A: We consider that the aluminium content of all infant formulas investigated herein is too high and especially so considering that these products constitute either all or a substantial proportion of an infant\'s diet in the first months of their lives.
Finding B: The nurse practice environment was the best predictor of poor-quality end-of-life care.
Finding C: Therefore, we believe that this report provides compelling evidence that a VLP-based immunotherapy approach can be beneficial in preventing tau pathology and could be applicable to diverse human tauopathies, such as Alzheimer\'s disease (AD), frontotemporal dementia (FTD), traumatic brain injury (TBI), and chronic traumatic encephalopathy (CTE).
Finding D: The present work is the first, in both animal and human, to show that tissues harvested from cadaveric ligaments up to 72 hours postmortem represent an available reservoir of specific stem cell populations.

Medicine_216_p$Medicine_66_r$Medicine_tw.text:
Finding A: This finding suggested that motility is possibly strong enough to modulate the force imposed on load-bearing bonds and drive active bacterial migration over endothelia under PCV shear stress.
Finding B: We further found that PC increased H2S production rate and CSE expressions, and protected young hearts from I/R-induced cardiomyocytes damage, all of which were disappeared in the aging hearts.
Finding C: More attention needs to be dedicated to investigating the varied development, function, and biology in lower urinary tract between females and males on a cellular level, a new review paper explains. #sexdifferences
Finding D: Multivariable logistic regression analysis indicated that the presence of acute brain lesions was independently associated with development of delayed neurological sequelae (adjusted odds ratio, 13.93; 95% CI, 7.16-27.11; P < .001).

Medicine_5_r$Medicine_340_r$Medicine_twe.text:
Finding A: Compared to wild moths, domesticated silkmoths seem to have less ability to smell environmental odours with their antennae and to locate host plants due to several millennia in captivity.
Finding B: Further analysis allowed them to find the exact sources of the methane--microbiological activity on the glacier bed.
Finding C: Lower results on IQ tests are associated with higher consumption of alcohol.
Finding D: The current study is the first to demonstrate that HS students are using e-cigarettes to vaporize cannabis.
